alternative_title: Food hygiene and safety - hazard analysis plan (HACCP)
body:
$!If you run a food business, you must have a plan based on the Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) principles. This keeps your food safe from biological, chemical and physical food safety hazards.$!

To make an HACCP plan you must:

* identify any hazards that must be avoided, removed or reduced 
* identify the critical control points (CCPs) - the points when you need to prevent, remove or reduce a hazard in your work process
* set limits for the CCPs 
* make sure you monitor the CCPs 
* put things right if there is a problem with a CCP 
* put checks in place to make sure your plan is working
* keep records 

%You might be inspected, and the inspector will need to see your records.%

You can get detailed [advice on food safety management](http://www.food.gov.uk/foodindustry/regulation/hygleg/hyglegresources/haccp/ "HACCP-based food safety management"){:rel="external"} based on HACCP.

*[HACCP]: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point
*[CCPs]: Critical Control Points
*[CCP]: Critical Control Point
overview: If you run a food business you must have a hazard analysis plan (HACCP) to meet food safety and hygiene standards
title: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point principles (HACCP)
